intro: Henriettea trinervia, commonly known as the three-veined fern, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves with three primary veins. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on slender pedicels. Henriettea trinervia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
